727941f-b.text:
Roosevelt Avenue, south side at Willets Point Boulevard, from underneath the B. M. T. and I. R. T. subway "El," showing this area before it was improved to serve the millions of visitors who came
to the 1939-40 New York Worldta Fair.
September 30, 1935
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
727941f-b.folder: Roosevelt Avenue & Willets Point Boulevard, Queens, NY
727941f-b.original_title: Queens: Roosevelt Avenue - Willets Point Boulevard

727941f-a.folder: Roosevelt Avenue & Willets Point Boulevard, Queens, NY
727941f-a.original_title: Queens: Roosevelt Avenue - Willets Point Boulevard

727942f-a.text:
Roosevelt Avenue, north side, at Willets Point Boulevard, viewing east and showing the Willets Point Boulevard station of the I. R. T. and B. M. T. subway systems. The area in the foreground was later improved as an auto parking space for visitors
to the New York World'e Fair of 1939-4O.
October 18, 1936
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
727942f-a.folder: Roosevelt Avenue & Willets Point Boulevard, Queens, NY
727942f-a.original_title: Queens: Roosevelt Avenue - Willets Point Boulevard

Roosevelt Avenue, north side, at Willets Point Boulevard, viewing east and showing the Willets Point Boulevard station of the I. R. T. and B. M. T. subway systems. The area in the foreground was later improved as an auto parking space for visitors

P. L. Sperr
727942f-b.folder: Roosevelt Avenue & Willets Point Boulevard, Queens, NY
727942f-b.original_title: Queens: Roosevelt Avenue - Willets Point Boulevard

727943f-b.text:
Roosevelt Avenue, south side, east from near Willets Point Boulevard, showing the I. R. T. and B. M. T. subway "El" on the former, running into Flushing across the Flushing River. This area was later improved to accommodate automobile visitors to the New York World's Fair 1939-40.
View 2 shows a more distant view of the "El" and the Flushing River bridge, seen from the Long Island Railroad tracks; view 3
shows a gas station near the Boulevard.
View 1: October 18, 1936
Views 2,3: Nay 30, 1938
P. L. Sperr
727943f-b.folder: Roosevelt Avenue & Willets Point Boulevard, Queens, NY
727943f-b.original_title: Queens: Roosevelt Avenue - Willets Point Boulevard

728198f-a.title: Queens: Willets Point Boulev - Roosevelt Avenue
728198f-a.text:
Wallets Point Boulevard, north from Roosevelt Avenue. The area in the foreground is being improved for the New York World's Fair of 1939-40.
View 1: June 16, 1937
View 2: May 30, 1938
View 3: October 18, 1936
P.L. Sperr

726658f-b.text:
Flushing Meadow Park (Queens): Viewing southeastward across the grounds of the World's Fair of 1939-40, seen from Roosevelt Avenue and Willets Point Boulevard. Clearly visible is the Trylon-the Fairs theme-- and some of the exhibition buildings under constraction.
View 2 shows the same area, in the Fair's second year of operation.
P.L. Sperr  View 1: May 30, 1938
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 2: June 23, 1940
